bibl.title: Hong v. Yuk. Decision from Judge
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: District Court of the 2nd Judicial of Washington Territory

div1.p: In the District Court holding terms at Olympia before Hon. John P Hoyt Judge. April 23rd 1885
Territory of Washington ex ut Sam Pong Petitioner vs. William Billings Respondent}

On reading and filing the petition of Sam Pong duly signed and verified by him whereby it appears that he is illegally restrained of his liberty by William Billings Sheriff of Thurston County, at the City of Olympia Thurston County Washington Territory and stating wherein the illegality commits from which it appears to me that a writ of Habeas Corpus ought to issue it is ordered that a writ of Habeas Corpus issue out of and under the Seal of the District Court of the Second Judicial District of Washington Territory holding terms at Olympia directed to the said William Billings sheriff of
Thurston County aforesaid commanding him to have the body of the said Sam Pong before me at Chambers in said Olympia on the 23rd day of April 1885 at 7 oclock PM to do and receive what shall then and there be considered concerning the said Sam Pong together with the time and cause of his detention and that he have then adn there the said writ.
